items.prompt: ________ the server crash, we would have finished the payroll processing on time.
items.explanation: This is a Type 3 inverted conditional: Had it not been for + noun (past impossibility).

items.prompt: Our current software is a ________ system; it was installed in 1995 and is no longer supported.
items.explanation: Legacy systems are outdated systems that are still in use.

items.prompt: ________ you have any questions regarding the new ERP system, please notify the IT department immediately.
items.explanation: Inverted Type 1 conditional: Should + subject + verb (formal way of saying 'If you have').

items.prompt: The marketing and sales departments don't share information, creating ________ that hinder our growth.
items.explanation: Data silos occur when data is held by one group and is not accessible by others.

items.prompt: ________ the CFO here, she would definitely approve the budget for cloud migration.
items.explanation: Inverted Type 2 conditional: Were + subject + adjective/noun.

items.prompt: Rewrite using inversion: If the company had invested in IT sooner, it would be more competitive now. -> [Had the company invested] in IT sooner, it would be more competitive now.
items.text: [Had the company invested] in IT sooner, it would be more competitive now.

items.prompt: ________ refers to the ability of a system to grow and manage increased demand.
items.explanation: Scalability is the capability of a system to handle a growing amount of work.

items.prompt: ________ it not for the high cost of implementation, we would have switched to an ERP system years ago.
items.explanation: Were it not for + noun is the inverted form of 'If it weren't for'.

items.prompt: We are currently undergoing ________ migration to reduce our reliance on physical on-site servers.
items.explanation: Cloud migration is moving business elements to a cloud environment.

items.prompt: ________ we known about the compatibility issues, we wouldn't have purchased this software.
items.explanation: Inverted Type 3 conditional: Had + subject + past participle.

items.prompt: Complete with a term: [ERP] software integrates various administrative functions into one unified system.
items.text: [ERP] software integrates various administrative functions into one unified system.
items.explanation: ERP stands for Enterprise Resource Planning.

items.prompt: The ability of our CRM to talk to our accounting software is called ________.
items.explanation: Interoperability is the ability of different systems to communicate and exchange data.

items.prompt: ________ you wish to opt-out of the digital newsletter, please update your preferences in the portal.
A high level of digital ________ means an organisation is well-prepared to exploit new technologies.
items.explanation: Digital maturity is a measure of an organisation's ability to create value through digital means.

items.prompt: ________ the deadline be missed, the project will lose its funding.
items.explanation: Inverted Type 1: Should + subject + passive infinitive (be missed).
